Welcome to Covid Dashboard’s documentation!¶

Converts hh:mm to seconds

time_conversions.hhmm_to_seconds(hhmm: str) → int¶

converts hh:mm to seconds

time_conversions.hours_to_minutes(hours: str) → int¶

Converts hours to minutes

time_conversions.minutes_to_seconds(minutes: str) → int¶

Converts minutes to seconds

This module handles the main functionality of Sched and Flask modules, as well as partial capability of updating the news and data. It listens out for input from the interface and updates accordingly to the specific input

main.add_data_update()¶

Updates the data that is stored and displayed on the dashboard, taking new data from covid19 API

main.add_news_articles()¶

This function changes the articles being displayed on the dashboard by adding new articles from the news API

main.index()¶

Main function for the website. Runs every time the /index page is loaded on the website. Scheduled updates run once the function is called next. Request.args.get() functions are called only if it receives input and create schedules updates

main.news_api_key = '8ed18da1a1574daeabb22e40ec5a979c'¶

Reads the config.json file and stores it into a dictionary which the values are then stored into individual variables for use within the code. If the config file is not found, it raises an exception and the initial values are used if they weren’t already declared in the try statement

Both the Covid19API and individual CSV files can be read and put into data form that can be used by the interface. Can fetch local and national data from the API

covid_data_handler.covid_API_request(location='Exeter', location_type='ltla')¶

Requests a json dictionary from the uk_covid19 API, using parameters to find certain locations in England

covid_data_handler.parse_csv_data(csv_filename)¶

Reads a CSV file and converts it into a list of each line

covid_data_handler.process_covid_csv_data(covid_csv_data: list)¶

Reads a list of lines from the CSV file and takes the useful variables usable in the dashboard

covid_data_handler.schedule_covid_updates(update_interval, update_name)¶

Schedules a data update

Creates a list of news articles for the dashboard, using the News API

covid_news_handling.news_API_request(covid_terms='Covid COVID-19 coronavirus', news_api_key='')¶

Uses the newsAPI to fetch a list of dictionaries from their website that will be displayed onto the interface and can add new news articles that are not currently in the list

covid_news_handling.update_news(terms, old_articles, current_len=0, news_api_key='')¶

Increases the number of articles displayed up to the limit given by reading from the list of new articles from the news API
